page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: 3.{The Hall.}This building started in the early 1800's was built in the Neo-Classical style using stone from a quarry in the grounds. The layout of the interior is simple. The main hall is a copy of the central courtyard of a Greek-Roman house, with the main rooms opening off it. The grounds of Belsay Hall were well-planned and cared for. Terraces surround the Hall leading down into various gardens, including a Quarry garden, Winter Garden, Magnolia Terrace and Meadow Garden housing a magnificient{"Pocket Handkerchief {Tree"}- so-called because of its large white bracts. The restoration of the gardens and buildings is now taking place and it is hoped to rejuvenate the original well-planned landscapes in the next few years.
